Predict Method for Slab and Shrinkage Linear Regression Models

predict.savvySh_model.Rd

Generate predictions (fitted values) or extract coefficients from a "savvySh_model" object produced by savvySh. This function allows you to specify which shrinkage estimator to use if multiple estimators are stored in the model.

Usage

# S3 method for class 'savvySh_model'
predict(
  object,
  newx = NULL,
  type = c("response", "coefficients"),
  estimator = NULL,
  ...
)

Arguments

object

A fitted "savvySh_model" object returned by savvySh.

newx

A numeric matrix of new data (with the same number of predictors) for which to generate predictions. Required if type = "response". If type = "coefficients", this argument is ignored.

type

A character string specifying whether to return fitted values ("response") or regression coefficients ("coefficients"). Defaults to "response".

estimator

A character string naming which shrinkage estimator to use. Must match one of the estimators in object$coefficients. If NULL, defaults to the first available estimator in object$coefficients.

...

Additional arguments (currently unused).

Value

If type = "response", a numeric vector of predicted values. If type = "coefficients", a named numeric vector of regression coefficients for the chosen estimator.

Details

The behavior depends on the value of type:

"response":

Returns predicted values for new data supplied via newx.

"coefficients":

Returns the estimated coefficient vector for the requested estimator.

If no estimator is specified, it defaults to the first one in the model object. For instance, a savvySh_model fitted with model_class = "Multiplicative" typically has "St", "DSh", and possibly "Sh" if include_Sh = TRUE.

See also

savvySh for fitting Slab and Shrinkage linear models, coef.savvySh_model for a direct way to extract coefficients without specifying type.

Author

Ziwei Chen, Vali Asimit, Marina Anca Cidota, Jennifer Asimit
Maintainer: Ziwei Chen <ziwei.chen.3@citystgeorges.ac.uk>
